Class Employee

java.lang.Object
users.Employee
Direct Known Subclasses:
Manager, RegularEmployee
public abstract class Employee extends Object
The Employee class serves as an abstract base for all employee types in the Firm Management System. This class defines common properties, behaviors, and operations that all employees share. RegularEmployee and Manager classes inherit from the Employee superclass and extends this classes abstract methods

  • Constructor Details

    • Employee

      public Employee(int ID, String Username, String Role, String Name, String Surname, String Phone, LocalDate DOB, LocalDate DOS, String Email, String Password, Boolean DEFAULT_PASSWORD)
      Constructs a new Employee object.
      Parameters:
      ID - Unique identifier for the employee.
      Username - Username for employee login.
      Role - Role of the employee in the organization.
      Name - First name of the employee.
      Surname - Last name of the employee.
      Phone - Phone number of the employee.
      DOB - Date of birth of the employee.
      DOS - Employment start date.
      Email - Email address of the employee.
      Password - Password for employee login.
      DEFAULT_PASSWORD - Indicates if the password is the default value.

    • Menu

      public abstract void Menu()
      Abstract method to display the menu for specific employee roles. Subclasses must implement this method to define role-specific menu operations.

    • ChangePassword

      public void ChangePassword()
      Prompts the employee to change their password. Enforces rules such as no spaces and a length between 8 and 16 characters.

    • ChangeEmail

      public void ChangeEmail()
      Prompts the employee to update their email address. Ensures valid formatting and checks for duplicates in the database.

    • ChangePhone

      public void ChangePhone()
      Prompts the employee to update their phone number. Ensures the new phone number is unique, has the correct format, and is numeric. The phone number must consist of a country code, followed by a 10-digit number. If the input does not meet the criteria, the user will be asked to try again

    • UpdateAll

      public void UpdateAll()
      Updates all profile fields: email, phone, and password.

    • UpdateProfile

      public void UpdateProfile()
      Displays a menu for updating specific profile fields or all fields. The following operations are available: 1. Change email 2. Change phone number 3. Change password 4. Update all profile information 5. Return to the main menu If the user enters an invalid input, the method prompts them to select a valid option between 1 and 5. When entered a valid input, the user is directed to the related method.

    • PrintProfile

      public void PrintProfile()
      Displays the complete profile of the employee.

    • Ccleaner

      public void Ccleaner()
      Clears the console screen. This method attempts to clear the console by running a system command. If an error occurs during the process, an error message is printed.
